page.title: 03GRAZIER AND BUTCHER
page.content: There is a small abattoir behind the village butcher belonging to G.Homewood and Son. It is used on Tuesday afternoon when they kill mainly bullocks, sheep and pigs. About 20 animals are killed and they come from local farms or the Ashford Cattle Market. The animals are killed with a bolt gun called CashX which fires a retractable bolt into the animals head. Pigs are then put into a Scalder-dehairer which removes the hairs. The meat is left to hang in a cool room overnight then put into cold storage. Beef is left for two weeks before being sold in the village shop. The hides go to make leather and the bones and hooves for glue.
